intro: Licania aracaensis, commonly known as the Aracaense licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its habitat in the dense rainforest, it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
